alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 1:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lincoln County through 145 PM MDT... At 108 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado 11 miles southwest of Thurman, or 18 miles northwest of Flagler, with little movement noted. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. There were earlier reports of funnel clouds north of Limon. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Lincoln County. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
